greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Cototient(n) := n - phi(n).
comment: Unlike totients, cototient(n+1) = cototient(n) never holds -- except 2-phi(2) = 3 - phi(3) = 1 -- because cototient(n) is congruent to n modulo 2. - _Labos Elemer_, Aug 08 2001
Theorem (L. Redei): b^a(n) == b^n (mod n) for every integer b. - _Thomas Ordowski_ and _Robert Israel_, Mar 11 2016
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. Browkin and A. Schinzel, On integers not of the form n-phi(n), Colloq. Math., 68 (1995), 55-58.
R. E. Jamison, The Helly bound for singular sums, Discrete Math., 249 (2002), 117-133.

Paul Pollack and Carl Pomerance, Some problems of Erdős on the sum-of-divisors function, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. Ser. B 3 (2016), 1-26. For Richard Guy on his 99th birthday. May his sequence be unbounded.
Carl Pomerance and Hee-Sung Yang, Variant of a theorem of Erdős on the sum-of-proper-divisors function, Math. Comp. 83 (2014), 1903-1913.
N. J. A. Sloane, Families of Essentially Identical Sequences, Mar 24 2021 (Includes this sequence)
formula: Equals Mobius transform (A054525) of A001065. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 11 2008
Dirichlet convolution square of A317846/A046644 gives this sequence + A063524.
program: (PARI) A051953(n) = n - eulerphi(n); \\ _Michael B. Porter_, Jan 28 2010
a051953 n = n - a000010 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 21 2014
print [i - totient(i) for i in range(1, 101)] # _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 17 2017
xref: Number of zeros in the n-th row of triangle A054521. - _Omar E. Pol_, May 13 2016
Cf. A063740 (number of k such that cototient(k) = n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 11 2018
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 21 1999
